title: Reduce clinical trial start-up timelines by 40-50%
description: Reduce clinical trial start-up timelines for UofA-led trials through streamlined UACT processes, harmonized SOPs, and embedded provincial workflows—with a stretch goal of idea to first site activation within 4 weeks via AI-augmented design.
expected_outcomes: Target: startup time reduced from 12+ months to 6 months; benchmark against RECOVERY trial
success_metrics: Median start-up time reduced from ≥12 months to ≤6 months; ≥10% of eligible trials achieve ≤4-week activation; benchmarking against RECOVERY-style trials.

title: Double trial recruitment efficiency
description: Double trial recruitment efficiency and create a patient engagement model that serves as a national resource, with explicit targets for Indigenous (15%), rural (20%), and pediatric participation.
expected_outcomes: Target: patient engagement model adopted by 3+ national networks
success_metrics: ≥2× recruitment rate relative to baseline; ≥15% Indigenous participation; ≥20% rural participation; patient engagement model adopted by ≥3 national networks.

title: Enable first-in-human and advanced-therapy trials
description: Enable first-in-human and advanced-therapy trials through Canada's first academic human challenge facility, integrated cell therapy manufacturing (ACTM), and the API biomanufacturing partnership—creating a complete discovery-to-production pathway.
expected_outcomes: Target: 5+ first-in-human trials including 2+ vaccine challenge studies; 3+ cell therapy trials; 2+ products advancing to CMPC scale-up
success_metrics: ≥5 first-in-human trials conducted; ≥2 spin-out or licensing arrangements; demonstrated regulatory readiness for cell and gene therapies.

title: Integrate biospecimens multi-omics and real-world data
description: Integrate biospecimens, multi-omics, and real-world data so that 70%+ of interventional trials have pre-planned biospecimen pipelines, FAIR-compliant data, and RWD-based follow-up linked to Connect Care. Manufacturing batch QC specimens archived for outcome correlation.
expected_outcomes: Target: batch-to-outcome traceability for 100% of API-manufactured products
success_metrics: ≥70% of interventional trials with pre-planned biospecimen pipelines; 100% FAIR compliance; ≥5–10 year longitudinal follow-up via Connect Care.

title: Embed AI across trial design enrollment monitoring and analysis
description: Embed AI across trial design, enrollment, monitoring, and analysis, creating a continuously learning clinical trials system with 8 deployable CRAIDL agents accessible as national infrastructure via ACT-AEC. Living Digital Twin integrates trial outcomes with API's QSP platform. PHAIR Lab leads implementation science research.
expected_outcomes: Target: 8 agents deployed; adopted by 5+ institutions; implementation science publications
success_metrics: ≥6 CRAIDL agents operational; full audit logging and 21 CFR Part 11 compliance; adoption by ≥5 institutions via ACT-AEC; ≥10 implementation science publications.

title: Establish pandemic preparedness clinical validation capacity
description: Establish pandemic preparedness clinical validation capacity through the Challenge Trial Unit, supporting PRAIRIE Hub vaccine programs (saRNA platform, Comparative Vaccine Platform) with human challenge studies that provide efficacy signals in months rather than years.
expected_outcomes: Target: 3+ controlled human infection model protocols validated; surge capacity for outbreak response
success_metrics: ≥3 CHIM protocols validated and operational; demonstrated surge capacity for outbreak response; integration with PRAIRIE Hub vaccine development pipeline.

title: Create a nationally interoperable clinical trials backbone
description: Create a nationally interoperable clinical trials backbone serving as a Western anchor for ACT-AEC, PRAIRIE Hub, and RareKids-CAN, with 10+ institutional partners. CTAP functions as the clinical validation engine connecting PRAIRIE Hub discoveries to API manufacturing to production.
expected_outcomes: Target: 10+ institutional partners; Western Canadian coordination role
success_metrics: ≥10 institutional partners connected; participation in OHDSI federation (100+ global sites); operational intra-Alberta data sharing via federated queries.

title: Train 150+ highly qualified personnel
description: Train 150+ highly qualified personnel in AI-enabled trial design and operations, including clinician-scientists and data scientists, with 20% from Indigenous communities and underrepresented groups. Shared GMP training rotations with API create dual-competent personnel.
expected_outcomes: Target: training curriculum adopted nationally; 25+ personnel completing cross-sector rotations
success_metrics: ≥150 HQP trained; ≥20% from Indigenous communities and underrepresented groups; training curriculum adopted nationally; ≥25 personnel completing cross-sector API rotations.
